articles.title: With an EBRD loan, electric locomotives will be procured for ŽRSM Transport
articles.summary: This is truly a big step forward for Railways for Transport – both in the area of cargo transport and in passenger traffic... articles.content:
This is truly a big step forward for Railways for Transport – both in the area of cargo transport and in passenger traffic… At the same time, this investment is also part of the broader vision for Skopje – improving air quality through the introduction of the city train, said Nikoloski.

Skopje – “Railways of the Republic of North Macedonia – Transport” and the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) signed a loan agreement in the amount of 20.9 million euros intended for the procurement of electric locomotives with spare parts, with the aim of enabling greater transport of goods and generating revenue for the enterprise.

As was stated before the signing, the project is an important step towards the modernization of ZRSM Transport, as well as towards improving the safety and efficiency of freight rail traffic.

– Today we are talking about something that has been neglected for decades, yet is of essential importance for the economy, exports and the European future of Macedonia, and that is the railway. The situation we inherited was catastrophic… The average age of diesel locomotives is over 60 years, and of electric ones over 40 years. This is not sustainable, neither economically nor in terms of safety, nor environmentally. Therefore, the goal of this procurement is clear – to increase the number of locomotives and the capacity for the transport of goods and thereby to increase revenues and financial stability, emphasized Prime Minister Hristijan Mickoski, according to whom this is a systemic renewal of the railway sector.

According to Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Transport Aleksandar Nikoloski and Minister of Finance Gordana Dimitrieska-Kochoska, the signing of the Agreement is a key step for the complete transformation of ZRSM Transport into a modern enterprise that will respond to the needs of its clients.

– Today we have the opportunity to complete an extremely important process that will mean the procurement of at least five new electric locomotives, together with accompanying spare parts. This is truly a big step forward for Railways for Transport – both in the area of cargo transport and in passenger traffic… At the same time, this investment is also part of the broader vision for Skopje – improving air quality through the introduction of the city train, said Nikoloski.

Minister Dimitrieska-Kochoska emphasized that the Loan Agreement is the result of intensive and constructive negotiations and represents confirmation of the trust that international financial institutions have in our policies and in the direction in which the country is moving.

The Head of the EBRD Office, Fatih Turkmenoglu, assessed the Agreement as a significant milestone in the progress of the transport sector in Macedonia.

– Today we mark a vital investment that will support the renewal of the railway fleet operated by the Macedonian railway transport company. This financing will enable North Macedonia to procure up to five new electric locomotives and to implement an enterprise resource planning system. These improvements represent much more than technical upgrades. They are strategic investments designed to improve the efficiency, quality and safety of freight rail operations and will contribute to reducing CO₂ emissions and will play a key role in supporting the country’s ongoing green transition, Turkmenoglu stressed. (30 December 2025)
articles.reasoning: The article reports a significant real-world investment in modernizing North Macedonia's railway system by procuring new electric locomotives, which will improve cargo and passenger transport efficiency, safety, and financial stability. Importantly, it also contributes to environmental benefits by reducing CO2 emissions and improving air quality in Skopje, aligning with the country's green transition goals. The story has broad societal impact, clear substance, and focuses on a single transformative infrastructure upgrade.
articles.personality_title: North Macedonia invests in new electric locomotives to modernize railways
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context** – North Macedonia's railway system has been using very old locomotives, some over 60 years old. This made transporting goods and passengers less safe, less efficient, and harmful to the environment.

**What happened** – On December 30, 2025, Railways of the Republic of North Macedonia (ZRSM Transport) signed a loan agreement with the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) for 20.9 million euros. This money will be used to buy at least five new electric locomotives and spare parts. The project also includes installing a new system to help manage the railway operations better.

**Impact** – This investment will modernize the railway system, making freight and passenger transport safer and more efficient. It will also help increase the company’s income and financial stability. Importantly, switching to electric locomotives will reduce CO₂ emissions, improving air quality in Skopje and supporting the country’s goal to protect the environment.

**What's next step** – The railway company will start using the new electric locomotives and implement the new management system. This will lead to better service for customers and help North Macedonia continue its green transition by reducing pollution.

**One-sentence takeaway** – North Macedonia is upgrading its railways with new electric locomotives to improve safety, efficiency, and environmental health while boosting the economy.
articles.personality_title_fr: La Macédoine du Nord investit dans de nouvelles locomotives électriques pour moderniser ses chemins de fer
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte** – Le système ferroviaire de la Macédoine du Nord utilise des locomotives très anciennes, certaines âgées de plus de 60 ans. Cela rendait le transport de marchandises et de passagers moins sûr, moins efficace et nuisible pour l’environnement.

**Ce qui s’est passé** – Le 30 décembre 2025, les Chemins de fer de la République de Macédoine du Nord (ZRSM Transport) ont signé un accord de prêt avec la Banque européenne pour la reconstruction et le développement (BERD) d’un montant de 20,9 millions d’euros. Cet argent servira à acheter au moins cinq nouvelles locomotives électriques et des pièces de rechange. Le projet comprend aussi l’installation d’un nouveau système pour mieux gérer les opérations ferroviaires.

**Impact** – Cet investissement modernisera le système ferroviaire, rendant le transport de fret et de passagers plus sûr et plus efficace. Il aidera aussi à augmenter les revenus et la stabilité financière de l’entreprise. Surtout, le passage aux locomotives électriques réduira les émissions de CO₂, améliorant la qualité de l’air à Skopje et soutenant les objectifs environnementaux du pays.

**Prochaine étape** – La compagnie ferroviaire commencera à utiliser les nouvelles locomotives électriques et à mettre en place le nouveau système de gestion. Cela offrira un meilleur service aux clients et aidera la Macédoine du Nord à poursuivre sa transition écologique en réduisant la pollution.

**Résumé en une phrase** – La Macédoine du Nord modernise ses chemins de fer avec de nouvelles locomotives électriques pour améliorer la sécurité, l’efficacité et l’environnement tout en renforçant son économie.
articles.personality_title_es: Macedonia del Norte invierte en nuevas locomotoras eléctricas para modernizar el ferrocarril
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto** – El sistema ferroviario de Macedonia del Norte ha estado utilizando locomotoras muy antiguas, algunas con más de 60 años. Esto hacía que el transporte de mercancías y pasajeros fuera menos seguro, menos eficiente y dañino para el medio ambiente.

**Qué pasó** – El 30 de diciembre de 2025, Ferrocarriles de la República de Macedonia del Norte (ZRSM Transport) firmó un acuerdo de préstamo con el Banco Europeo para la Reconstrucción y el Desarrollo (BERD) por 20,9 millones de euros. Este dinero se usará para comprar al menos cinco nuevas locomotoras eléctricas y piezas de repuesto. El proyecto también incluye instalar un nuevo sistema para mejorar la gestión del ferrocarril.

**Impacto** – Esta inversión modernizará el sistema ferroviario, haciendo el transporte de carga y pasajeros más seguro y eficiente. También ayudará a aumentar los ingresos y la estabilidad financiera de la empresa. Además, cambiar a locomotoras eléctricas reducirá las emisiones de CO₂, mejorando la calidad del aire en Skopje y apoyando la meta ambiental del país.

**Próximo paso** – La empresa ferroviaria comenzará a usar las nuevas locomotoras eléctricas e implementará el nuevo sistema de gestión. Esto ofrecerá un mejor servicio a los clientes y ayudará a Macedonia del Norte a continuar su transición verde al reducir la contaminación.

**Una frase clave** – Macedonia del Norte está modernizando su ferrocarril con nuevas locomotoras eléctricas para mejorar la seguridad, eficiencia y el medio ambiente mientras fortalece su economía.
